## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
dice <- function(faces=6,n=100)
{
  sample(x = seq(from = 1, to = faces, by = 1),size=n, replace=TRUE);
}
# génère 10 tirages d'un dé à 6 faces
dice(6,471)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r}
library(dplyr);
library(magrittr);
experiment <- function(faces = 6, n = 100)
{
  dice1 <- dice(faces,n);
  dice2 <- dice(faces,n);
  dice3 <- dice(faces,n);
  
  data.frame(Dice1 = dice1,
             Dice2 = dice2,
             Dice3 = dice3);
}
# génère une expérience de 5 tirages de 3 dés à 6 faces
experiment(6,100000) %>%
mutate(Som = Dice1 + Dice2 + Dice3) %>%
  group_by(Som)%>%
  summarize(N=n());
#calcule le nombre d'occurences de chaque valeur possible de somme
```
```{r}
library(dplyr);
library(magrittr);
experiment <- function(faces = 6, n = 100)
{
  dice1 <- dice(faces,n);
  dice2 <- dice(faces,n);
  dice3 <- dice(faces,n);
  
  data.frame(Dice1 = dice1,
             Dice2 = dice2,
             Dice3 = dice3);
}
# génère une expérience de 5 tirages de 3 dés à 6 faces
experiment(6,100000) %>%
  mutate(Som = Dice1 + Dice2 + Dice3) %>%
  group_by(Som)%>%
  summarize(N=n())%>%
  filter((Som == 9)|(Som == 10));
#calcule le nombre d'occurences de chaque valeur possible de somme
```
```{r}
library(dplyr);
library(magrittr);
library(ggplot2);

experiment <- function(faces = 6, n = 100)
{
  dice1 <- dice(faces,n);
  dice2 <- dice(faces,n);
  dice3 <- dice(faces,n);
  
  data.frame(Dice1 = dice1,
             Dice2 = dice2,
             Dice3 = dice3);
}
# génère une expérience de 5 tirages de 3 dés à 6 faces
experiment(6,100000) %>%
  mutate(Som = Dice1 + Dice2 + Dice3) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=as.factor(Som)))+
    geom_bar(aes(y=(..count..)/sum(..count..)),width=.3) + xlab("Valeur de la somme") + ylab("Frequence")+
    ylim(0,NA)+
    theme_bw();
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
